name: df-atl
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2
body: |- wceq(cal, crab(s0, clat, wa(wcel(cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), cdm(cfv(cglb, cv(s0)))), wral(s1, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wi(wne(cv(s1), cfv(cp0, cv(s0))), wrex(s2, cfv(catm, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s2), cfv(cple, cv(s0)), cv(s1))))))))
bodyPretty: ⊢ AtLat = { s0 ∈ Lat |((Base ` s0)∈ dom((glb ` s0))∧ ∀(s1 ∈(Base ` s0),(s1 ≠(0. ` s0)→ ∃(s2 ∈(Atoms ` s0), s2[(le ` s0)]s1))))}
comment: Define the class of atomic lattices, in which every nonzero element is greater than or equal to an atom. We also ensure the existence of a lattice zero, since a lattice by itself may not have a zero. (Contributed by NM, 18-Sep-2011.) (Revised by NM, 14-Sep-2018.)
